text: Hesperia pahaska, the Pahaska skipper, is a butterfly of the family Hesperiidae. It is found from North America in a narrow belt of states extending from Texas to North Dakota, just reaching Canada in southern Saskatchewan and Manitoba.Pahaska Skipper, Butterflies of Canada The wingspan is 28–33 mm. The flight period is from June to early July in the northern U.S. The larvae feed on blue grama (Bouteloua gracilis), fluff grass (Erioneuron pulchellum), Poaceae species, and Tridens pulchella. ==Subspecies== Listed alphabetically.Hesperia, funet.fi *H. p. martini MacNeill, 1964 *H. p. pahaska *H. p. williamsi Lindsey, 1940 ==References== ==External links== *Pahaska Skipper, Butterflies and Moths of North America Category:Hesperia (butterfly) Category:Butterflies described in 1938
title: Hesperia pahaska
